headline: RTX Profits Shot Up This Year Amid Strong Military And Commercial Sales. Composite Rating Hits 97
summary: Its earnings growth has escalated over the last three quarters.  The upgraded Composite Rating shows that RTX, formerly known as Raytheon, is among the top 3% of all stocks for a group of the most important fundamental and technical metrics.  On Tuesday RTX posted 17% third quarter earnings growth to $1.70 per share.

headline: RTX Corp. (RTX) Soars on Double-Digit Earnings Growth
summary: We recently published 10 Stocks Leaving Wall Street in the Dust. RTX Corporation (NYSE:RTX) is one of the best performers on Tuesday. RTX Corporation rallied to a new all-time high on Tuesday, adding 7.67 percent to close at $173.04 apiece as investor sentiment was fueled by a double-digit jump in third-quarter earnings, coupled with a […]

headline: Raytheon (RTX) Margin Improvement Reinforces Bullish Narratives Despite Slower Revenue Growth
summary: RTX (RTX) boosted its net profit margin to 7.7%, up from 6% last year, signaling stronger profitability this quarter. Earnings grew 39.7% year-over-year, well ahead of the company’s 5-year average of 30.8% per year. However, revenue growth is expected to trail the broader US market at a projected 4.6% per year. Investors are likely weighing this sustained earnings momentum and expanding margins against a slower revenue outlook and elevated valuation metrics as they assess whether RTX can...
